clinical_guidance: Standard tapering protocols apply. Low risk of withdrawal complications.
Standard tapering protocols apply. Monitor for latent symptoms.
Consider extending taper duration by 25%. Monitor for 'unmasking' of symptoms.
Physiological reserve is reduced. Cut standard dose reduction steps in half (e.g., reduce by 10% instead of 20%).
High risk of withdrawal causing confusion/falls. Use 'Hyperbolic' (very slow) tapering.
Extreme Caution. Withdrawal stress may precipitate delirium. Extend taper steps to 6-8 weeks.
Approaching end of life. Only deprescribe if medication is causing overt harm. Taper very slowly.
Symptom control is priority. Deprescribing is based on 'Time to Benefit'. If drug provides no symptom relief, stop immediately. If withdrawal causes distress, maintain dose.
